hypothesis_content.title: Negative News Overreaction Reversal in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, when BTC experiences a sharp intraday drop (>5%) on negative macro news headlines, but the BTC futures funding rate remains neutral or slightly positive (within ±0.005%), price will mean-revert 50% of the initial drop within the next 24 trading hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In neutral regimes, sharp moves are often driven by sentiment and liquidity flushes rather than structural shifts. If funding rates don't turn significantly negative, it suggests leveraged longs aren't aggressively unwinding, and the drop may be an overreaction to scary headlines. The reversion targets the midpoint of the panic move.
entry_conditions: BTC 4hr close down >5% from prior 4hr close
Negative macro news catalyst identified (e.g., 'scarier macro catalyst' headline)
BTC perpetual funding rate (aggregate) between -0.005% and +0.005% at time of entry
Regime confidence >55% and classification is NEUTRAL

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC price reaches level equal to entry price + (0.5 * magnitude of the initial 5%+ drop)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price drops further to 1.5x the initial drop magnitude from the pre-drop high

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Fewer than 55% of qualifying setups achieve the 50% retracement target before the 24-hour time exit or hit stop loss.
